description: More than a million people arrived in Europe in 2015. Five years on, we reflect on what's changed.
title: Europe's migrant crisis: The year that changed a continent
title_page: Europe's migrant crisis: The year that changed a continent - BBC News
maintext: Jenny Hill, Berlin correspondent: Angela Merkel, like all of us, was horrified by the lorry discovery. It seemed to have a profound impact on her. Just days later she said at least 800,000 people would likely seek asylum in Germany that year. And for the first time she used what would become her catchphrase: "wir schaffen das" - we will manage it.
